info.author: mecforlove
info.description:
# Ecoji 🏣🔉🦐🔼

Ecoji encodes data as 1024 [emojis][emoji], its base1024 with an emoji character set.  As a bonus, includes code to decode emojis to original data.
The idea is from [here](https://github.com/keith-turner/ecoji). And this project is the implemention of Python3.

## Installing

- with pip

```bash
$pip install ecoji
```

- with source code

```bash
$git clone git@github.com:mecforlove/ecoji-py.git && cd ecoji-py && python3 setup.py install
```

## For CLI usage

- encode

```base
$echo -n hello | ecoji
👲🔩🚗🌷
```

- decode

```bash
$echo -n 👲🔩🚗🌷 | ecoji -d
hello%
```

If you want to know more about the CLI, just type `ecoji -h` in your terminal.

## For python lib

- encode

```python
>>> import io
>>> from ecoji import encode
>>> r = io.BytesIO(b'hello')
>>> w = io.StringIO()
>>> encode(r, w)
>>> print(w.getvalue())
👲🔩🚗🌷
```

- decode

```python
>>> import io
>>> from ecoji import decode
>>> r = io.StringIO('👲🔩🚗🌷')
>>> w = io.BytesIO()
>>> decode(r, w)
>>> print(w.getvalue())
b'hello'
```

Last but not the least, only Python3.x is supported.
info.name: ecoji
info.summary: Encode and decode data as emojis.
info.html_description:
# Ecoji 🏣🔉🦐🔼

Ecoji encodes data as 1024 [emojis][emoji], its base1024 with an emoji character set. As a bonus, includes code to decode emojis to original data. The idea is from [here](https://github.com/keith-turner/ecoji). And this project is the implemention of Python3.

## Installing

  • with pip

`bash $pip install ecoji `

  • with source code

`bash $git clone git@github.com:mecforlove/ecoji-py.git && cd ecoji-py && python3 setup.py install `

## For CLI usage

  • encode

`base $echo -n hello | ecoji 👲🔩🚗🌷 `

  • decode

`bash $echo -n 👲🔩🚗🌷 | ecoji -d hello% `

If you want to know more about the CLI, just type ecoji -h in your terminal.

## For python lib

  • encode

`python >>> import io >>> from ecoji import encode >>> r = io.BytesIO(b'hello') >>> w = io.StringIO() >>> encode(r, w) >>> print(w.getvalue()) 👲🔩🚗🌷 `

  • decode

`python >>> import io >>> from ecoji import decode >>> r = io.StringIO('👲🔩🚗🌷') >>> w = io.BytesIO() >>> decode(r, w) >>> print(w.getvalue()) b'hello' `

Last but not the least, only Python3.x is supported.
